circumstances: Clive Roberts went missing during an excursion to a national park with his colleagues. The group intended to unwind after a busy week, and Clive, known for his love of nature, often led such ventures. The plan was to explore the area around a scenic river located within the park. They congregated at Minto Place, Dundee, before embarking on their journey. At some point during the hike, Clive separated from the group, expressing a desire to explore a nearby path that led closer to the river. When Clive didn't return after several hours, his colleagues grew concerned and notified authorities. After a search effort, Clive was found safe but disoriented, having lost his way back from the riverbank.
q_17_explanation: Clive's disappearance was uncharacteristic during a group outing.
q_18_explanation: Clive expressed interest in exploring but didn't return.
q_20_explanation: Clive intended to explore a new path but got lost.
